fields.summary: Sample data item for create issue on Kanban board should note that the project needs to be set correctly
When I create a project and fill it with sample data from GreenHopper it doesn't become my current project so an issue I create is in the wrong project
Summary for "Starting a Sprint" in sample data is confusing, stories don't move in to the sprint backlog until it is started

fields.description:
As a Project Administrator I would like the ability to generate a Sprint Workload Report similar to the [Version Workload Report|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA040/Version+Workload+Report] from JIRA.

The Version Workload Report displays time tracking information on the current workload for a specific version within a specific project.
For the specified version, it shows a list of unresolved issues assigned to each user, each user's workload, and a summary of the total workload remaining for the version.

!https://confluence.atlassian.com/download/attachments/213525776/versionworkload_report-report.png?version=1&modificationDate=1240007645312!
fields.summary: Sprint Workload Report

# Try to transition that issue to another column

Expected behavior:
Since we are allowed to select multiple ticket at once in Rapid Board (Work), we should be able to transition these issue at once.

This bug is generated from SAC:
https://support.atlassian.com/browse/JSP-122856
fields.summary: Unable to move multiple tickets at a time between Rapid Board (Work) columns
As a use GH should create OD compliant projects. From the welcome mat it does not respect all-app-access requirement in ondemand
The copy for sample data project deletion is inconsistent for ondemand
As on ondemand user I want to be able to use sample data

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Software Cloud*. Using *JIRA Software Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWSERVER-5839].
  {panel}

Steps to replicate:

# Create a scrum board
# Create two issues, assign one to yourself and one to someone else (or unassigned)
# Rank the issue assigned to someone else as higher than yours
# Select the filter 'Only My Issues'
# Drag the sprint marker to below your issue
# Unselect the quick filter 'Only My Issues'

RESULT: the other issue will also be included in the sprint

DESIRED RESULT: Only the issue seen in the quick filter will be included in the sprint
fields.summary: Dragging sprint marker over issues includes all issues ranked higher

fields.description:
Suggestion from MCB

COS:
- Javascript based filter on the manage rapid board list
- Filter on all fields visible on the manage page (type, name, owner, shares, saved filter)
- Search not persistent (i.e is reset when page reloaded)
fields.summary: As a manager, I'd like to be able to filter the board list on the Manage Boards page to ones that match something I type

fields.description:
COS:
- User custom field type
- Group custom field type
- Another RESTful table for people section

(!) Development Notes (!)

Q: How many users and groups can we add to the detail view? Any limit?
A: (/) No actual users or groups are added, only defined custom field containing users / groups. There is no limit on the amount of custom fields displayed

Q: Where is the people section located?
A: (/) In the rapid board config page, under the issue detail view tab. In the third table.

Q: Are users/groups notified when they are added to a board?
A: (/) They aren't actually added to the board. The issue detail view will display custom fields of a type related to people (user picker, group picker, ...). 

Q: What if a person/group added to the board does not have permission to see it (aka no permission to see the filter)?
A: (/) The person or group does not know that he is being displayed in the issue's detail view on the rapid board. 

Q: Will this be a new tab on the vertical jump nav?
A: (/) No, the people custom field will be displayed in the details tab of an issue detail view, under the people section (under assignee and reporter)

Q: What if a user or group is deleted while displayed on the board?
A: (/) The link to the person / group is displayed. If the person or group is deleted then following the link will show an appropriate error page.

Q: What if a user/group is renamed?
A: (/) The link will still work. The changes will be reflected on the next refresh of the data

Q: Do any of these questions surprise you? If so, what hadn't you previously considered?
A: (x) Not Answered
fields.summary: As a user, I would like to configure user or group custom fields to be shown on the detail view

fields.description:
COS:
- Label custom fields
- Select & Multi select custom fields - Check & multi check - Radio
- Version custom field 

(!) Testing Notes (!)

Q: How many of these fields can you add?
A: (/) As many as you like

Q: Will these be selectable in the detail view? Or only the current state of the field?
A: (/) Read-only

Q: How will we display a field with multiple selections?
A: (/) Comma-separated 

Q: Will there be any problem adding fields that have duplicate names?
A: (/) No, field configuration is stored by id. It would be hard to know which one is which though
fields.summary: As a user, I would like to configure label, select, check, radio and version fields to be shown on the detail view

fields.description:
COS:
- Resolution 
- Environment 
- Security level 

(!) Testing Notes (!)

Only plays for this type of story include:
* deleting the field when assigned
-> this field is a system field so we can't delete it. I tried to hide it but we don't honour those settings (see https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/GHS-5831?focusedCommentId=412545&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:comment-tabpanel#comment-412545)
 
* restricting permission to particular users
-> the user will see an error message saying that it is not possible to access the issue after security level configuration change and on board reload the issue will not be visible in the list

* checking behavior when naming fields as system-wide objects (Unassigned) and duplicates
-> we can create a custom field with the same name as a system field (like resolution, environment and security level). It will be selectable in the field list in the Issue Detail View tab of the configuration page.
fields.summary: As a user, I would like to be able to configure the resolution, environment and security level fields to be shown on the detail view

fields.description:
COS:
- Business Value
- Custom fields of type numeric 
- If the same as the estimate statistic do not offer it to add
-- If already added, show a warning in the configuration page, and do not show in Detail View on board

Testing:
- Kanban vs Scrum boards - story points are handled differently

(!) Testing Notes (!)

Q: What if you add business value when it is already the selected estimate field?
A: The currently selected estimate field should not appear in the dropdown list. The only time it does if if you change the estimate field then click Issue Detail tab without refreshing the page. In this case, it does nothing when you try to add it. 

Q: What if you added business value before setting it as the estimate statistic?
A: It does not appear in the issue detail. When you view the configuration, there's a message against the field. 

Q: If we allow both, do they update properly when either of them is updated?
A: (x) Not Answered (don't understand this one)

Q: How many fields can we add? Are there any limitations?
A: No

Q: Any issues when the user cannot edit the field?
A: No

Q: Can you add duplicate fields?
A: No

Q: What happens when a number field is changed to another field type?
A: I don't think this is even possible.

Q: What happens if the field is deleted after it was added?
A: It should show up as not valid with a message on the config page and does not show up in issue detail. 

Q: Any limit to the length of input to the 

...?
fields.summary: As a user, I would like to be able to configure the business value (or any other numeric field) to be shown on the detail view

fields.description:
COS: 
- Due Date 
- Resolution Date 
- Custom fields of date type
- Second restful table for dates 
- Go in to the dates section

(!) Testing Notes (!)

Q: Be sure to test with Greek and Korean dates
A: (x) Not Answered

Q: What if the selected day is a non-working day?
A: (x) Not Answered

Q: What happens when you change the JIRA date format with the field in place?
A: (x) Not Answered

Q: How many dates fields can you add to the detail view?
A: (x) Not Answered
fields.summary: As a user, I would like to be able to configure the due date or any other date field on to the detail view

fields.description:
Aren't these pages duplicated?
https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/GH/Adding+an+Issue+to+an+Epic
https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/GH/Removing+an+Issue+from+an+Epic

There are pages with the same content, but instead of Epic it is Sprint, which is right.
fields.summary: Duplicate pages - Epic and Sprint

fields.description:
h2. Acceptance Criteria
* The supported setup is 
** a "Scrum of Scrum" Board with a filter query that can span multiple projects, and 
** a separate board for every team. 
** How the JQL could look to make the team-specific distinction is unclear. (currently, this could be done with a label; something more dedicated to a team would be nicer)
* The rapid board (SoS and for every team) shows an active sprint as soon as its filter selects an issue that is currently in a sprint
** _Note: this is currently working_
* In the sprint planning, the teams can pull the stories that they think they can complete in that sprint. These stories will automatically be manipulated to match the JQL so that it will show up in the team's specific board.
** _Note: Manually, this is also sorts of working. By pressing "l" I can quickly label an issue with "team-alpha", "team-beta", etc.); A more automated and/or team-oriented way would be nice_
* Sub-tasks for the user stories that a team selected will show up in the team specific board (related to GHS-5301). 
** _Note: This is the only part that is currently lacking. The options I am currently aware of both involve extra plugins:_
**# Auto-Inherit the labels from it's parent
**# Extend the JQL so that I can query for parent issues. For example: ... OR parent(labels = team-alpha) ...

This Story is somewhat related to GHS-5542, but with a common Sprint defined for all teams, you gain a more concise reporting and task boards. (I hope...) Also GHS-5410 is similar to this request, as I understand GHS-5410 it is created under the assumption, that you create two different sprints in two different boards in the same project, while this user stores suggest to have a common sprint that works over several boards.

h2. Sprint Planning Flow
* Plan the new Sprint in the "Scrum of Scrums" Board
** Select User Stories for all teams, include them in the next upcoming sprint
** Assign the User Stories to a team (label them, or do whatever is necessary)
* Do the second part of the Sprint Planning in the Team Specific board. Create Subtasks for all User-Stories
* When all the Sprint Planning is done, start the Sprint in the SoS Board.
fields.summary: As a multi-team one backlog user, I want to have a common Sprint defined for several teams with seperate Sprint Backlogs, so that I only have to define the Sprint once and still have seperate tasks boards and charts for the teams

fields.description: Several Scrum teams work according to the same sprint periods. All teams contribute to the same sprint results and finally the same release. So, Sprint definition wrt. name needs to be consistent across the teams. As an administrator I would like to define the sprint names centrally so that the individual team Product Owner can choose from the names of unreleased Sprints when going from Planning to Work Mode.
fields.summary: as an Adminstrator for several Scrum Teams I want to be able to define the name of any Sprint used by the individual Product Owners
Empty sprints in plan mode are deleted when you complete a sprint in work mode

fields.description:
If you press Add in two different browsers you can add the same field twice

is this a big deal.  Maybe not
fields.summary: You can add the same field in twice

fields.description:
Check discussion
https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/83343/disable-rapid-board-operation-when-jira-project-is-not-included-in-the-greenhopper-enabled-projects
fields.summary: As an admin, I can configure greenhopper such that it doesn't show the 'Rapid Board' operation on an issue view

fields.description:
In the classic mode, you can filter the task by assignee, version, ... and you have a total of estimate work for each employee. In the new version, there's no way to do this. It's possible to add quick filters manually for each developer, but for the estimate time, there is no workaround...

See attached screenshot from the classic mode.
fields.summary: Add System Filter in the planning mode

fields.description: We need the fields "assigne" and "fixed version" for each ticket in the planning-mode view. Plaease add the possibilite to customize the templates, like in the classic mode. But in this case, all templates must bei customisable (in the classic mode, the "Compact List" ist fixed (except the corner field).
fields.summary: Templates for Scrum Board Views

fields.description: It should be possible to have sub-tasks in a sprint, but the main-task not. We have many big tasks for 2-3 sprints, splitted in subtasks. At this time, this tickets will not shown in the planning mode if the parent-task is not in the same sprint. Without this feature, the subtask-functions is unusable for us....
fields.summary: Sub-Tasks without main-task in the same sprint

fields.description: In the GreenHopper Burndownchart-Widget, there is no link to the detail view of the sprint (planning board). There is only a link to the hole project and version.
fields.summary: Burndownchart-Widget: Add a link to the detail view of the sprint

fields.description: At this time, you can remove a ticket from a sprint, but this ticket will be removed not completly if a sprint has startet, the time is fixed in the sprint history/burndowm chart. In our business, we have to replace some urgent tickets during the sprint. Example: One Ticket with 1 Story Point will removed, and another with 1 Story Point added. Please ad another option "Remove completely from sprint". We know, thats not realy scrum like, but thats the reality.
fields.summary: Remove a ticket completly from a sprint

fields.description:
We are currently using "original time estimate" as the estimation statistic AND have Time Tracking using remaining estimate and work logging enabled.

The effect we now have is that, whenever stories or tasks are not completed in a sprint they get moved back to the backlog (which is perfectly normal), however, when using the planning board after that, the "total work" for the next sprint you plan, will use the original estimates of the stories.
When you have a story of 2days work and only 2h left, this is not desired of course as the sum of sprint work the planning board shows are useless.

It would be solved (for us) by enabling us to choose "remaining estimate" as an estimation statistic, next to original estimate.

Next to that, on the "work board" the estimates in the lower corner of the cards should consequently also show the "remaining time" instead of the original estimate.
fields.summary: As a user, I want to associate "Remaining Estimate" as the Estimation Statistic on an agile board

fields.description:
In Rapid Board, the quick view issue screen is not showing user's customfield. This cause inconsistency between JIRA and Greenhopper view issue page.

*Expected Behavior:*
Quick view issue screen in Rapid board should show the customfield so the user don't have to go outside Greenhopper

!customfield.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Show user's customfield in Rapid Board view issue screen

fields.description:
On the planning board initially the quick manual to create boards is presented. Once you click on one of the cards the details of the card will be visible. 

It would be good to be able to hide this column fully so only the cards are displayed
fields.summary: Hide the right hand side of the planning board

fields.description:
We are having trouble visualizing the time spent/time needed to complete a milestone.  What we really need is a horizontal bar chart that represents work completed on a milestone (in time) and estimated work to be done on the milestone (in time).  It would also be very useful if it provided a indication of the currently worked time as well.

I have provided a mock-up of the thing that we would really need.  The following inputs to the wallboard/confluence gadget would be:

* project
* field to list upon (could be fix version, Epic/theme, custom fields \[important! - see below\*], etc)
* complete issue types (multi select of issue types)

Then the gadget would display the total time spent on any issue in the complete issue types (it could show the estimated time also, but that's not as important).  The total time spent on new non-closed types and the estimated time.

It would be great as well to show when issues have gone over the top of their estimates.

\* I would like to explain the custom fields input:

* We use a custom field called milestones to group our issues (that are just labels) due to the way we work with Kanban boards so would like to see the times associated to these issues.

This is a *major problem* we have with visualizing the estimated times involved with completing a milestone. The current Roadmap in JIRA/Greenhopper on shows a comparison of done/not-done issues which isn't a useful indicator.
fields.summary: Visualising Time Spent/Needed on Milestone

fields.description:
I didn't find a good way with the RapidBoard to show the global state of the project.

The perfect view will be a global/release burndownchart (not based on a sprint but on a version)

Ideally I would like to give either the start date, the end date and if the tasks are not already identified at least a start global estimation (either in story points or in original estimate time).

A release burndownchart would help the PO and the team to see if at the global view the project is going well.

On this kind of chart it can be interesting to see appear the sprint frequency just to say the release will be done in N sprint.
fields.summary: As a user I want to visualize a global/release burndownchart to know the global status of my backlog

fields.description:
Repro :

Copy a board backed by a filter say named "Klingon"

You geta  copied filter called "Copy of Klingon"

Copy the same base board again and it fails with :

Error message : Filter with same name already exists.

Its not handling the name clash properly.

Suggestion : start adding number suffixes until it succeeds or you get to 100 say.

eg

"Copy of Klingon 1"

"Copy of Klingon 2"
fields.summary: Auto naming of copied filters does not handle names clashes

fields.description:
Created an upcoming sprint called "Dream On".

Created a second upcoming sprint, auto named to "Dream On 2".

Renamed second sprint to "Things we should do next".

Renamed first sprint to "Things we should do next".

Realised we should rename second sprint to "Dream On". Click on / around sprint name, name flipped to "Dream On" automagically.

On creation of a third sprint, the name of the second sprint flipped back to "Things we should do next".

[~mwatson@atlassian.com] was the driver, so double check with him. [~tim@atlassian.com] was another witness.
fields.summary: Multiple sprint renaming strangeness
Populate the details view with the configured fields

fields.description: Our organization needs to be able to see due dates on any cards that have assigned due dates.  It is important for us to be able to quickly see due dates and compare due dates on multiple cards.  Having this on the detail view does not address our need.  We need the due date on the cards.
fields.summary: I would like to see the Due Date on the rapid board cards.

fields.description: Currently, if I want to delete an attachment from a ticket, I have to open the ticket and move out from the Board view. It would nice to be able to delete attachments within the Board view.
fields.summary: Add feature to delete attachment from Board view

fields.description:
Similar to GHS-1201 for the classic boards and the overall sprint progress visible from a Scrum Planning page.

Our team now lives on cross-project scrum boards, so the classic planning board wont cut it.

PM's like the sprint report and planning overview, but want details at an assignee level.

If using the "Assignee" swim lanes on a scrum board I should see a nice red, yellow, green bar with the appropriate metric (hours or points) for each assignee.


I am marking the business value high here because a competitor plannig product does have this and it has been cited as "the" reason to use the bloated cludgy tool over lightwieght and fast jira/GH combo.
fields.summary: As a project manager I should be able to see Sprint Progress by Assignee

fields.description:
So that I can do any filter I want on the Rapid Board/KanBan Board/Scrum Board, 

As a user, I want to be able to type any JQL into a text box to filter the board issues on-the-fly,

Without being restricted to Quick Filters defined by the administrator.
fields.summary: "Filter By Query" box for Rapid Board
Add XSRF protection to SetIssueDisplay on CardBoardAction
Add XSRF protection to ConfigurationAction and subclasses (Global and Project) for all page pop methods
Add XSRF protection to LicenseAction

fields.description:
Based on https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/81790/automatic-version-swimlane


Can we have an option in Rapid Board Configuration for Swimlanes to "Base Swimlanes on" a new Entry for fixVersion?
fields.summary: Automatic Version Swimlane

fields.description:
I would like to be able to see what my team capacity is for a given sprint while I am in sprint planning. This way we can fill up our time bucket with stories by person and by team total to make sure we are not over committing. We do not use Story Points, we use Original Estimates in our rapid board.

Example:
Sprint Sept. 7th - Sept. 28th (16 days x 75% allocation (6hrs per person per day) = 248hrs for the sprint 
1. Joe - 66
2. Tom - 72
3. Beth - 72
4. Jack - 72
fields.summary: As a Scrum Master I want to be able to track team capacity for a given sprint at the team member level and then sum to team total

fields.description:
I'd like to have the ability to use the notion of Upcoming sprint in JQL searches.

For instance, I have planned 2 sprints ahead of the current open sprint. I'd like to be able to filter separately the issues planned in upcoming sprints 1 & 2, using the advanced search. I would use this search query to create swimlanes in Kanban boards or create structures within the Structure plugin.

Note that future sprints don't have a date so autocomplete needs to be revisited.

h3. Workaround via database:

https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/How+to+find+issues+from+non-started+sprints
fields.summary: Ability to use the Upcoming Sprint value or name in JQL searches

fields.description:
If the SPRINT field contains value and is correctly displayed on the issue screen, click Views->XML. The xml contains information about the SPRINT customfield but its value is empty.

This bug causes following issue with IDE Connectors:
* user opens issue in the IDE Connector (it is based on the issue XML view and contains information that Sprint value is empty)
* user makes changes and submit issue with the Sprint value empty
* the Sprint value is erased on the JIRA side (ups!)
fields.summary: XML view for issue contains empty value for field SPRINT

fields.description:
Acceptance Criteria
* Assume you have multiple teams working on the same product backlog
* There is a general board for the product backlog, and also team specific boards, using a subset of the issues in the product backlog (for example issues that have a label "team-1")
* The Sprint is created in the general board, but before the sprint is started you should create all technical tasks for it. It'd be nice if this could be done in the team-specific board.
fields.summary: As a member of the development team of multiple scrum teams, I want to see planned sprints in my board plan view so that I can create subtasks for it during sprint planning II

fields.description:
Team,

In the Classic planning view, when I created an epic, it had a label field "Epic/Theme", which was also visible in the Epic card. A click on that label opened a view to create new stories for that epic. The Epic/Theme label is no longer available in Rapid Board. This is useful when we are creating multiple story in the same Epic/Theme.

Can we bring this feature back in Rapid Board?

Thanks,
fields.summary: Bring back the Epic/Theme label field in Rapid Board.

fields.description: Need to be able to modify the Details tab on the Rapid Board in a similar way that you can modify screens for the rest of Jira.
fields.summary: Should be able to customize the Details tab under Rapid Board in Agile
Drag and drop in to current sprint on plan mode does not respect escape properly (hit escape and it'll still be added to the sprint)

fields.description:
If I move some Stories from one fixVersion (Sprint X or Unscheduled) to another fixVersion, the rank-field of the Stories is not updated. Thus if I moved cards around for a while and they have diverse rank values they may appear in seemingly random order in the newly assigned fixVersion. If this happens, I am not able to find the Stories again and thus my Backlog becomes ever less maintainable...

This was initially reported as a BUG here: https://support.atlassian.com/browse/GHS-5320 (there are examples, too)
fields.summary: As a GH user I would like all rank fields of cards of a version to become newly indexed so that cards moved to a Sprint/Unscheduled always appear on top

fields.description: This was reported by a [feedback item|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/FEEDBACK-4045]. Looks like Ctrl click does not work for multi selecting issues, I can't confirm for sure that it ever did on Windows because I never really tried it before.
fields.summary: Ctrl Click no longer works on Windows/Chrome when trying to select multiple issues

fields.description:
- Performed a test of the behavior of *GreenHopper* to see if the drag-and-drop feature to work when context of *Story Points* is applied.
- Suggestion to allow the *drag-and-drop* to be enabled in this scenario.

*Additional note*
- When issues are being moved from a version (Eg. Version 1) to *Unscheduled*, they are being sorted in random order but you are allowed to drag-and-drop issues in this case
fields.summary: Suggestion on the drag-and-drop feature on the Planning Board

fields.description:
Seen on JAC via 6.0.2-rc1.

The link on the parent task in work mode does not allow you to bring up the issue details tab for that issue.

I spoke to [~pobara] about this and he thinks its a regression.
fields.summary: OPINION: Parent issue stub is not interactive

fields.description:
Created a release from the Kanban board, giving release date of "27/08". When looking at JIRA's version management, it's the 26th, so either JIRA or GH doesn't respect the timezone setting.

My user timezone is set to GMT+10 Sydney, I did this on 27/08 around 1:50pm local time.
fields.summary: Kanban release feature doesn't take timezones into account properly
Epics prototyping
SOKE performance testing handoff

fields.description:
Possibility for internal users to submit and document ideas. 
Product or Scrum team to evaluate idea and promote it as story.
fields.summary: New item type "idea" for enabling users to submit ideas to product or Scrum team

fields.description: I would like this ability because our team was very new to greenhopper and accidentally started many sprints by accident with incorrect items in them.  I am not so much worried about deleting them as I am just wanting to rename to say "Test Sprint 1" etc. This will help from a visual perspective to tell which are "real" sprints and which are not real sprints.
fields.summary: As a Project Manager in JIRA I want to be able to rename completed sprints that were added by mistake, so that I can clear up any confusion when looking at historics of sprints

fields.description:
When using the Rapidboard, detailed card view, and looking at a large entry in the description field:
- If there is a need to edit, or select any data in the Description, activating the inline editing collapses the field area to ten lines of text. If a stacktrace or activity log, for example, is in the description field, this limits what I can see as the context of any surrounding text I might be editing or selecting.  Improvement seen to allow option to show larger fields. Improvement seen to activate full module entry for editing, or, at least, constrained to the current web browser window as related to the available space for the column.

-This may relate to other fields where large amounts of data may be entered.
fields.summary: As a User, I want larger text fields available for inline editing in detailed view of a card

fields.description:
When using the Rapidboard, detailed card view, and looking at a large entry in the description field:
- If there is a need to edit, or select any data in the Description, activating the inline editing pushes your cursor to the top of the field.  With large descriptions (stacktraces, activity logs, etc.) you have to re-scan the data to find your place again.  Improvement would retain your cursor placement where activating inline editing.

-This may relate to other fields where large amounts of data may be entered.
fields.summary: As a user, I want inline editing of the description to retain my cursor placement in the editing field

fields.description:
On a Kanban board, if an issue is moved to the standard <DONE> column, it will be marked as either Closed or Resolved. However, when viewing the issue the Resolution field still shows "Unresolved". 
This can be confusing to users. 

Steps to reproduce.
*Create a new project with the default workflow
*Make a new Kanban board
*Make an issue
*Move the issue from To Do or Progress to Done.
*Check the issue details.

As a workaround, please see https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/GHKB/Unable+to+set+issues+to+Resolved+using+Greenhopper+Simplified+Workflow
fields.summary: Closing an issue in a Simplified Workflow Kanban leaves Resolution as 'Unresolved'

fields.description:
COS: 
- New link type
- Need service to link/unlink 
- Only valid between an Epic issue type and a Story issue type
fields.summary: As a user, I want to link scipe to stories

fields.description:
COS: 
- Configuration per board
-- New tab in config page
- Any text custom field in the system
-- Double check that fields for Estimation are not filtered based on issues in board
- Text custom field will be read only on detail view
- Add and remove fields
-- If possible - reordering of fields
- Fields are displayed at the *bottom* of the *top* section on the *Details* tab i.e. underneath Fix Version
- Read only display for now

(!) Testing Notes (!)

_(Answers by mtokar)_

Q: How many text fields will we allow?
A: Unlimited - as many as there are in the system to be added

Q: Which text fields will be allowed, and are there any that are prohibited?
A: Only Custom Fields which are of a "text" type - in the standard custom field types this means Text Area, Small Text and URL

Q: What happens if the name of the attached field is modified?
A: Nothing should happen - field is assigned by ID

Q: Who has permission to add these fields?
A: Board owner and admins

Q: Are these fields added per board, or per project, or global?
A: Per board

Q: What happens when we remove then re-add a text field?
A: It will be in a different position to before, but otherwise nothing.

Q: What if a user does not have permission to see the attached field?
A: There are no user permissions for fields. But if the field is not applicable in the scope of the selected issue (i.e. it is not configured for that issue type or project), then it will not be displayed on the detail view.
Regardless of scope, all text custom fields are available to be added (if they have not already been added).

Q: If a field is added while a user has the detail view open, do we require a full page reload or just a detail view refresh to see it?
A: Just reload detail view.

Q: Can users add GreenHopper fields to the details tab? This could lead to odd behavior in the case of Story Points.
A: No special GreenHopper fields are currently allowed to be added.

Q: Will we only allow text fields, or number fields as well?
A: At the moment only text fields

Q: Will these fields be inline editable in the detail view?
A: At the moment read-only.

Q: Will these fields be XSS safe?
A: They should be, yes.
fields.summary: As a rapid board user, I'd like to be able add/remove text custom fields to the bottom of the detail section of the detail view

fields.description:
When troubleshooting burndown charts, one common problem is when an issue's history is not reflecting what has actually happened. This could be because of missing history entries due to changes occurring in workflows after the history is generated. In rare cases, it could be due to a bug in the time tracking in GreenHopper.

I would like to have GreenHopper quickly identify any issue that currently has a remaining estimate that is not possible to reach with the history. I.E. Issue was created with 10h estimate, worked for 4, closed with the post function reducing it to zero. But there is no history marker for the reduction to zero. The issue's current value should be 0 and the history / GreenHopper's burndown data should tell us 6 hours remaining. Because of that difference, I want a red flag on the issue, or a way to find that issue quickly in order to diagnose charting issues.
fields.summary: As a Support Engineer I want GH to tell me when an issues current Time Estimates are not achievable with the available history

fields.description:
During the 6.0.2-SNAPSHOT blitz I created a MAN (MANCHESTER) project and tried to view the issues in the Classic Task BOard.

They did not show.  Martin and I could not work out why this is the case and hence raised this issue.

h3. Problem

The project was created from GH's Getting Started page, using the new Simplified Workflow. This workflow employs statuses "To Do", "In Progress", "Done".

Upon viewing the Classic Task Board, the mapping is set by GreenHopper to map the To Do column to use the JIRA default statuses, instead of our "To Do" status. Likewise for the Done column. The In Progress column is correctly mapped to the "In Progress" status.

This is why no issues are visible - because all the issues are in To Do status.

To fix the problem, just go to the Configuration of the Task Board and adjust the mappings of statuses to columns.
fields.summary: Classic Task is missing issues in a version - GDOG blitz data

fields.description: As a user I'd like to see the progress of all concurrent versions of products on a kanban board - it would be good to just select a quick "Base Swimlanes On" option to select by versions instead of manually putting in JQL for each version separately.

Show agile type on Getting Started tabs

fields.description:
In the classic Planning Board, every stories has been shown up correctly based on the drop down of the view mode. From there, comparison on backlog stories consist of issues/business value/story points can be easily seen and decision can be easily make.

The current board would require us to click on the stories one by one in order to show the details. That is painful when it comes to compare the stories before decision making.
fields.summary: Viewing Mode drop down in classic Planning Board to appear in the new board

fields.description:
While we can appreciate how nicely the new Rapid Boards will fit into our development cycles there are a few things that we would like to see changed.
1. DISPLAY ACCEPTANCE TESTS - When you are on the Planning Board and you are looking at a story the story displays on the right hand side of the screen, it would be very beneficial to show the acceptance tests within that view. Oftentimes during our Sprint Planning sessions we review the stories with the teams and then read through the acceptance tests in order to develop an accurate estimate.
2. CREATION OF STORIES - When creating a story on the Planning Board within the new rapid board it would be nice to easily rank the story that you are creating within the backlog immediately without having to add it and then having to drag and drop it from the bottom to where it's priority should be. Oftentimes, I already know the priority for the story when I am creating it and don't want it to always go to the bottom and then I have to rank it later.
fields.summary: Using the new Rapid Board to Manage Projects

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Software Cloud*. Using *JIRA Software Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWSERVER-5691].
  {panel}

COS: 
- Something in the filter tab 
- Click through to the column tab

(!) Testing Notes (!)

Q: Alert? Dialog? Dismissable?
A: Warning, shown in Filter tab. Not dismissable. 

Q: Count of issues not displayed?
A: Nope

Q: Do you get this message as soon as there exists an issue which is unmapped?
A: Whenever you view the filters tab and there is an issue unmapped (current user). Other users on page refresh/load of configuration.

Q: Is this only for statuses that currently have issues in them, or any unmapped status?
A: Only unmapped statuses that have issues in them. 

Q: Does the message immediately disappear when the last applicable status becomes mapped?
A: Yes, once you fix the last unmapped status with issues, then view the filters tab, it no longer appears (current user). Other users on page refresh/load of configuration.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Software Cloud*. Using *JIRA Software Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWSERVER-5681].
  {panel}

1. Create a workflow which sets Remaining Estimate to 0 when task goes to Resolved state.
2. Set remaining estimate on a task to 10h
3. Greenhopper shows Time Remaining is 10h
4. Resolve task using drag drop in Greenhopper
5. Expected : Greenhopper release shows 0h remaining
   Actual : Greenhopper release shows 10h remaining

*Workaround*

Update change history for an issue and store the issue in the database as the last post function in the workflow.
fields.summary: Editing Remaining Estimate using custom workflow does not cause Greenhopper to update Time Remaining on release

Similar to the way we do this for Filters and Dashboards. The list of Boards is growing pretty quick and it is getting more and more difficult to find the Board we are looking for.

GHCreateNewIssue.jspa is not protected against XSRF attacks.

It works IF you dont have the affected sprint selected at the time

This was caught thanks to Petes testing notes

fields.description:
S+T and S+B is awesome but with the Planning mode and iterations I find myself wanting a but more. 

# Drop from iteration (Send Out S+O?) - I want to move the issue out of the iteration and leave it on top of the non-iteration Backlog.
# Send to top of non-iteration backlog - I'm currently planning an iteration, I'm going through the Backlog and find an issue I want to keep an eye out for, but not move it into the iteration yet - I just want to move it to the top of the non-iteration backlog (S+T will send it to the very top)

fields.description:
At the moment, when a user cannot move an issue from one column to another, there is no exception or explanation of why the user cannot do it.  The only hint that the user will have when the user cannot drag an issue to another column is that the column will not be highlighted.  

It would be convenience for the users to have a detailed explanation (such as Only Reporter can move to this column) if the user cannot drag issues to another column.
fields.summary: As a user, I would like to see a detailed exception as to why I am not able to transition from one column to another

fields.description:
I started to work a with the (Rapid) Board … but I must confess that I’m missing hardly some features which gives me a better “helicopter view” - and not only a limited sprint (plan mode) and active tasks focus (work).

Yes - I'm aware of all the concepts of agile development.

But this does not replace an overall vision where do you want to go.

_*It's just not being able to see the forest for the trees*_

So the goal is to have e.g. an overview about potential releases (e.g. quarterly based) and one up to thirty epics per release.

Target group: Product Management, C-Level

I think this is one of the essential downsides compared to the "classic" mode.

We are still working in classic mode on 24" monitors and small fonts - and it provides an _excellent overview_ compared to the new board which takes the complete screen.

No - I won't expect a UI which is useable on every device (smartphone, tablet) - to the contrary if this would lead to "one-size-fits-all" approach just to ride the mobile device wave.

Next to that, we need to drag and drop Epics from release to release, quarter to quarter (or sprint to sprint which is usually around +/- 2 weeks) - so ideally based on the the complete long list of all items.


I took a look to the Pivotaltracker (e.g. Public project: Open Tapestry https://www.pivotaltracker.com/projects/102714/stories ) and I discovered immediately some real neat features I really would like to see in GH.


So I’m not suggesting to extend the current "plan" mode, but adding an additional mode like "big picture mode", "forrests mode" or  "vision" mode – some kind of "zoom out".


Looking forward for your feedback.
fields.summary: A "helicopter view" or "vision mode" for a big picture next to sprint and task focused views (forrests and trees)
